website_summaries.verdict: A cotton liner that works like a sheet in your sleeping bag for a more comfortable night's sleep.
pros: A sleeping bag liner made from material used for sheets
Can be used alone and on top of other bedding or in a sleeping bag
Polyester material with a soft finish
Also comes in a double width size
cons: There is no zipper on this bag
It cannot be opened and laid flat

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, love the color.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our mudroom, where we use the wood stove, for getting comfy purposes. The house is super rustic, so it's nice to have soft spots. The color of this set fits in perfectly with our earth toned linens (and walls). It's great in combination with our olive-y green pillow case set, so it looks less sloppy to have the stuff laying around. Super soft and comfy material, feels well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use when you are uncertain of a bed you will be using
customer_reviews.text: The concept of this type of sheet set is novel because for people who are concerned about the cleanliness of where they are staying, this can help provide a peace of mind and give them a good nights rest. The set overall folds up nicely is soft to the touch, and it’s easy to set up and begin using. I was impressed with the overall comfort of using them and then when you’re finished you can for them up take them home wash them and have them ready for your next adventure. Definitely worth considering and is a good value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Wanpaku

customer_reviews.title: Quality travel sheets.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for camping or when staying at hotels. The fabric is very high quality with nice color options and is very lightweight. It feels soft and cool on the skin. It is machine washable and designed to shield the sleeper from bugs and germs.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Florida Summer Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I chaperoned a scout camp for a week in central Florida. Weather was warm, muggy, steamy, and even my 2 season sleeping bag would be too heavy. This was a fantastic alternative. Kept the mosquitos away, and was just enough covering to be comfortable. Didn’t get sticky and gross. Perfectly comfortable! Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag liner
customer_reviews.text: Bought two different sleeping liners and stuck with this one. This liner was not the most light weight but it was soft, roomie, and comfortable which is why I chose it over the other liner. I used it back packing at hotels in South East Asia. Loved it and I will keep using in the future. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Paradiso

customer_reviews.title: Sheet is soft and wonderful texture. Worked perfect for trip staying at hotels
customer_reviews.text: Sheet is soft and wonderful texture. Worked perfect for trip staying at hotels . Has side opening so easy to get in and out. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: So soft
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING. I will not be traveling without it, especially when camping. It is so so so soft. It's perfect for sleepers like me, who go to bed freezing, but wake up in the middle of the night, sweating. Allows you to still have some coverage but be cooler and not sleep completely in a sleeping bag. The last night of my most recent camping trip, I just slept in this and used my sleeping bag for extra cushion. It also was a great way to keep the 4 day music festival funk and dirt out of my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, happy overall
customer_reviews.text: Slept in it the first time out of the bag. Very soft and comfortable. Worked exactly how I needed it to. I'm 6' tall and fit fine. Fits 1 person.
customer_reviews.author: Cayci Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling and camping!
customer_reviews.text: I used this liner for a lengthy summer camping trip and am so happy I did. First, I don’t like sleeping bag fabric on me while I’m sleeping. It sticks to me and yuck. I’d just sleep on top of the sleeping bag inside this liner. On the colder nights I’d use it as an extra layer inside the bag. We stayed a couple nights in a hut at a campground and they had questionable linens. I felt protected using the liner, all the way up and over my pillow. It felt cozy and it washed up very nicely. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: .athena.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hotels
customer_reviews.text: Makes hotel beds feel cleaner. Thicker material and good quality, not super soft but not scratchy. Double size a bit small for those sleeping together that use bigger beds but worth it for cleanliness. Husband uses it alone when he travels and loves it. Can be a bit tricky the first time to figure out so try it at home where it is cleaner before traveling. Hard to get back in the bag, you have to fold it, not stuff it. Compact size.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Was great for traveling & keeping sleeping bag clean.
customer_reviews.text: It was good and did everything it claimed to. Getting in and out was a little difficult at times with the way one side is sewn up half the way and the other is not sewn at all and closes with only two little snaps. Tangling up was very easy and straightening it up in the morning could be like puting a puzzle together at times.
customer_reviews.author: Mshl

customer_reviews.title: Used for Spray Tanning
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something I could sleep on if I got a spray tan later in the day and didn't want my sheets to turn brown. This is exactly what I was looking for! The fabric is great, very cool, and I love the snaps along the side.
customer_reviews.author: madewade

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy more than once
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to line m heavy duty sleeping bag during a trek in Nepal, and it did a decent job of keeping me in softness amid a big, bulky bag. I got a little tangled up in it here and there, but that was fine. I have since used it a few times in somewhat sketchy hotels, and it gave me some piece of mind about bedbugs and the like. My only quibble is that this doesn't fold up smaller, which would make it a lot easier to take on backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Recommended by a friend who said she ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Recommended by a friend who said she also told many other friends who bought it and loved it. So soft and comfy. I use it for travel, you never really know how clean hotel sheets are, and for a meditation sound bath on top of my yoga mat.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Pile

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for self-tanners
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my bed on nights that I have applied self tanner. Keeps my sheets and pillows from getting stains from the tanning solution. It’s soft and does its job well!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel!

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer trips and camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who was on a sailing trip and needed a lightweight cover for sleeping. All positive comments from him on its use. It worked perfect for sleeping on the boat and he has chosen to take this to camp instead of a traditional sleeping bag. He says it’s provides enough cover and is comfortable. In the summer he finds regular sleeping bags too hot for camping. I think he will get years of use out of this.

customer_reviews.title: Hate hotel bedding? This is for you!
customer_reviews.text: Makes is a bit more difficult to get in and out of and the way it holds a pillow, but with a bit of patience I made it work. Small trade off as this a great way to protect yourself from hotel sheets. We hate hotel bedding, this did the trick. Very soft material and laundered up nicely.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made

customer_reviews.title: Must have

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel

Besides the obvious germs, they use a lot of bleach and it actually makes my face red if I use those pillow cases. So this is the perfect solution for me! Will use this for business travel as well as camping.
customer_reviews.author: shamrocksmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  I ordered another.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this for camping in Texas. Sleeping bags tend to be way to warm. This provides a nice layer between me and my sleeping pad. When I get home I just throw it in the washing machine. Ordered a second one.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Side Openint
customer_reviews.text: The product as a soft, light weight travel sack can't be beat. However, the sack is sewed up so high that you have to crawl to the top of the bag to get in! A light-weight zipper would have been better when you have to slip out during the night to p--. Also, the bag really twists as you move in it. Designer, please try it out . I quit using it as a sleep sack and just used it as a bottom sheet, thus went without a second layer for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic snap and weird design
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic snap and weird design. There is a flap at the top possibly to cover a pillow, but not big enough to cover the whole thing. I am 6’1”. This thing isn’t long enough so I wind up wound up in it - and awake in the middle of the night.

customer_reviews.title: great selection, great to use

It is easy enough to throw a blanket over the sheets if you need extra layers. The sheets folded nicely and fit right in the pouch to easily pack in my suitcase.
